result.markdown:
---
title: "Análises estatísticas - Regressão"
format: html
editor: visual
message: false
warning: false
---


## Pacotes


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_7dc4634409ab995275609c7e0829cbae'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
library(tidyverse)
library(DHARMa)
library(emmeans)
library(patchwork)
library(ggthemes)
library(performance)
library(multcomp)
library(agricolae)
library(MASS)
library(forecast)
library(writexl)
library(epifitter)
```
:::


Na aula de hoje, realizaremos a análise dos dados de um experimento de blocos casualizados. Como são 3 fatores, deveremos realizar 3 ANOVA's para comparação das médias.

### Importação dos dados


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_3937e8dea7d66e3ea250296375ea92fa'}

```{.r .cell-code}
soja <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/7/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=866852711")
soja
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 32 × 5
    TRAT BLOCO   DFC   FER  PROD
   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
 1     1     1  10    17    4611
 2     1     2  10.5  21    4312
 3     1     3  12    25    4545
 4     1     4  11    18    3409
 5     2     1   6.2   6.5  5023
 6     2     2   6     4    4839
 7     2     3   7     8    4903
 8     2     4   6.5   5    4975
 9     3     1   6     6    5235
10     3     2   6.2   3.5  5014
# ℹ 22 more rows
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_dc6d64ac6a7702e3fd16c2d02debebd8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
soja <- soja |> 
  mutate(TRAT = as.factor(TRAT),
         BLOCO = as.factor(BLOCO))
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f70d15a9c14a12873cfa4c0878aad40c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
dfc <- soja |> 
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, DFC))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.5, color = "gray")+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black", size = 0.5)+
  theme_classic()
  

fer <- soja |> 
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, FER))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.5, color = "gray")+
   stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black", , size = 0.5)+
  theme_classic()

prod <- soja |> 
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, PROD))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.5, color = "gray")+
   stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black", , size = 0.5)+
  theme_classic()

plot1 <- dfc + fer + prod
plot1
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_08_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Análise de variância

O bloco entra como efeito fixo, por isso soma-se.

## DFC


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_97b52fff5cb80bf6fcc4070eb2a08b89'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_dfc <- lm(DFC ~ TRAT + BLOCO,
              data = soja)
anova(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: DFC
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
TRAT       7 149.299 21.3284 51.5490 8.218e-12 ***
BLOCO      3   0.461  0.1537  0.3716    0.7743    
Residuals 21   8.689  0.4138                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Checar homocedasticidade e normalidade


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_e9e84d9bf6bc91e91f907bec0ffbd0a4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.532).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.978).
```
:::
:::


Neste caso, não é calculada a média aritmética. É uma estimativa do valor médio pelo modelo de ANOVA. É comum acharmos que os valores médios estão errados, por serem diferentes da média aritmética.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_5c3bd44c0c32a8d6affb4ca66b2f64df'}

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_dfc <- emmeans(aov_dfc, ~ TRAT)
medias_dfc
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 1     10.88 0.322 21    10.21    11.54
 2      6.42 0.322 21     5.76     7.09
 3      6.05 0.322 21     5.38     6.72
 4      4.75 0.322 21     4.08     5.42
 5      4.20 0.322 21     3.53     4.87
 6      4.00 0.322 21     3.33     4.67
 7      4.08 0.322 21     3.41     4.74
 8      4.58 0.322 21     3.91     5.24

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::
:::


Neste comando, os valores à direita das médias (diagonal) indicam se há ou não diferença. Os valores à esquerda indicam a distância em relação à média.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_b653df20692a0b699a4ade60a432e37e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        1       2       3       4       5       6       7       8
1 [10.87]  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001
2   4.450 [ 6.42]  0.9896  0.0249  0.0017  0.0006  0.0009  0.0107
3   4.825   0.375 [ 6.05]  0.1329  0.0107  0.0040  0.0058  0.0628
4   6.125   1.675   1.300 [ 4.75]  0.9202  0.7173  0.8072  0.9999
5   6.675   2.225   1.850   0.550 [ 4.20]  0.9998  1.0000  0.9896
6   6.875   2.425   2.050   0.750   0.200 [ 4.00]  1.0000  0.9020
7   6.800   2.350   1.975   0.675   0.125  -0.075 [ 4.07]  0.9499
8   6.300   1.850   1.475   0.175  -0.375  -0.575  -0.500 [ 4.57]

Row and column labels: TRAT
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (emmean) 
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::
:::


Neste comando, o que poderia ser feito manualmente chuck anterior, pode ser feito automaticamente, indicando se existe ou não diferença.

Premissas da ANOVA.

Normalidade dos resíduos e homogenidade da variância.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_8ed763abcc0a9f3f3dbc65965920b742'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(medias_dfc, Letters = letters)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 6      4.00 0.322 21     3.33     4.67  a    
 7      4.08 0.322 21     3.41     4.74  a    
 5      4.20 0.322 21     3.53     4.87  a    
 8      4.58 0.322 21     3.91     5.24  ab   
 4      4.75 0.322 21     4.08     5.42  ab   
 3      6.05 0.322 21     5.38     6.72   bc  
 2      6.42 0.322 21     5.76     7.09    c  
 1     10.88 0.322 21    10.21    11.54     d 

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 8 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


Repetindo para os outros exemplos (FER e PROD)

## FER


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_1de1e9fd7835cc9d5da82a2bcb15aa6f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_fer <- lm(FER ~ TRAT + BLOCO,
              data = soja)
anova(aov_fer)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: FER
          Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
TRAT       7 978.87 139.838 55.1717 4.218e-12 ***
BLOCO      3   3.84   1.279  0.5045    0.6834    
Residuals 21  53.23   2.535                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_24195e0ee86726e28d6753eded8f14d0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_fer)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_fer)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.008).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(aov_fer))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_08_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Como não há normalidade e heterocedasticidade, tentaremos transformar os dados.

Realizou-se a transformação boxcox. Lambda.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_d68ec20e3ea9e534b233822f20232aa8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
b <-boxcox((lm(soja$FER + 0.1 ~ 1)))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_08_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_2a4f580fb4ebf7eba984c79b259ad470'}

```{.r .cell-code}
soja$FER2 <- (soja$FER ^ lambda - 1) / lambda

aov_fer2 <- aov(FER2 ~ TRAT + BLOCO, data = soja)

anova(aov_fer2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: FER2
          Df   Sum Sq   Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
TRAT       7 0.036632 0.0052332 12.5567 3.033e-06 ***
BLOCO      3 0.005360 0.0017865  4.2867    0.0165 *  
Residuals 21 0.008752 0.0004168                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_fer2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.790).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_fer2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.834).
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_9250f97a03ccb4bc10b3fa7dd414cddf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_fer2 <- emmeans(aov_fer2, ~ TRAT)

medias_fer2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 1     0.621 0.0102 21    0.600    0.642
 2     0.584 0.0102 21    0.563    0.605
 3     0.543 0.0102 21    0.522    0.564
 4     0.519 0.0102 21    0.498    0.540
 5     0.530 0.0102 21    0.509    0.551
 6     0.515 0.0102 21    0.494    0.536
 7     0.536 0.0102 21    0.515    0.557
 8     0.540 0.0102 21    0.519    0.561

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_fer2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
         1        2        3        4        5        6        7       8
1  [0.621]   0.2155   0.0005   <.0001   <.0001   <.0001   0.0002  0.0003

```

## PROD


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_0578030800fc1cd1499914e7bbea0f0a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_prod <- lm (PROD ~ TRAT + BLOCO, 
                data = soja)

anova(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: PROD
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)  
TRAT       7 2993906  427701  2.6367 0.04021 *
BLOCO      3  105665   35222  0.2171 0.88340  
Residuals 21 3406431  162211                  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.542).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.215).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_prod <- emmeans(aov_prod, ~ TRAT)

medias_prod
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 1      4219 201 21     3800     4638

 6      5256 201 21     4837     5675
 7      5128 201 21     4709     5546
 8      5078 201 21     4659     5497

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

pwpm(medias_prod)
```

```

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_ad04c16e1917237e7c462861ebd20bc7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_prod <- data.frame(medias_prod)
df_prod |> 
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, emmean))+
  geom_point()+
  ylim(2000, 6500)+
  geom_errorbar(aes(min = lower.CL,
                    max = upper.CL,
                width = 0.1))+
  theme_classic()+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 1.2, y = 4200,
           label = "A")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 2.3, y = 4900,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 3.3, y = 5150,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 4.3, y = 5150,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 5.3, y = 5150,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 6.3, y = 5300,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 7.3, y = 5150,
           label = "AB")+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 8.2, y = 5100,
           label = "B")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_08_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Para criar uma tabela de acordo com os dados usados no grafico acima.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_d93993286cb552a0499e8af795981708'}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_prod <- cld(medias_prod, Letters = LETTERS)
df_prod <- as.data.frame(df_prod)
knitr::kable(df_prod |> dplyr::select(TRAT, emmean, .group))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
|   |TRAT |  emmean|.group |
|:--|:----|-------:|:------|
|1  |1    | 4219.25|A      |
|2  |2    | 4935.00|AB     |

|5  |5    | 5122.00|AB     |
|7  |7    | 5127.50|AB     |
|4  |4    | 5140.25|AB     |
|6  |6    | 5256.25|B      |
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
write_xlsx(df_prod, "df.xlsx")
```
:::


## Aula 08 - parte 02

Dados na planilha "dados diversos", usar a aba "curve"


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_1e9c33754303c75bbbcd1fb9bd179ea3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
curve <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1807247585")
curve
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 60 × 4
   Irrigation   rep   day severity
   <chr>      <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>
 1 Furrow         1     0     0.01
 2 Furrow         2     0     0.01
 3 Furrow         3     0     0.01
 4 Furrow         1     7     0.04
 5 Furrow         2     7     0.04
 6 Furrow         3     7     0.04
 7 Furrow         1    14     0.1 
 8 Furrow         2    14     0.1 
 9 Furrow         3    14     0.11
10 Furrow         1    21     0.11
# ℹ 50 more rows
```
:::
:::


Experimento de campo, em blocos casualizados.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_2c069185adeda6cdce8e936719f8420d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
curve |>
  group_by(Irrigation, day) |> 
  summarise(mean_sev = mean(severity)) |> 
  ggplot(aes(day, mean_sev, color = Irrigation))+
  #geom_area(aes(
  geom_point(color = "black")+
  geom_line()+
  facet_wrap(~ Irrigation)+
  labs(title = "Índice de severidade",
       x = "Dias", 
       y = "Severidade (%)")+
  theme(legend.title.position = "bottom")+
  theme_bw()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_08_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Calcular a curva abaixo da área de progresso.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_8007a561b974b1eb662318c1884b3215'}

```{.r .cell-code}
curve2 <- curve |>
  group_by(Irrigation, rep) |> 
  summarise(aacpd = AUDPC(day, severity))
curve2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 3
# Groups:   Irrigation [2]
  Irrigation   rep aacpd
  <chr>      <dbl> <dbl>
1 Drip           1  13.0
2 Drip           2  13.9
3 Drip           3  13.3
4 Furrow         1  13.5
5 Furrow         2  14.1
6 Furrow         3  13.7
```
:::
:::


aacpd = area abaixo da curva de progresso

### Anova


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_83f072a077ad5ae2671432d483221ff4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_curve <-lm(aacpd ~ Irrigation + factor(rep),
             data = curve2)
anova(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: aacpd
            Df  Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)  
Irrigation   1 0.23602 0.236017  10.605 0.08275 .
factor(rep)  2 0.61291 0.306454  13.771 0.06770 .
Residuals    2 0.04451 0.022254                  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Não foi observada diferença entre os tipos de irrigação quando calculada a AACDP.


::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_b2715a5d07ccbd56b15a40190548fd1f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.704).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.380).
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_08_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_f44f578b355f01113f0176b98c88510d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cv.model(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.097572
```
:::
:::
